metadata.Title: CVE-2023-0616 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
If a MIME email combines OpenPGP and OpenPGP MIME data in a certain way Thunderbird repeatedly attempts to process and display the message, which could cause Thunderbird's user interface to lock up and no longer respond to the user's actions. An attacker could send a crafted message with this structure to attempt a DoS attack. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 102.8.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-0616` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
